item.title: [317]Adding custom Items[317]
item.dc:creator: @Mumi_jnr Mumi_jnr
item.description:
@Mumi_jnr wrote:

Can anyone help?
I’m using Project Fubergens v8.1 Client, and I want to add custom items to it.
I’ve been trying for HOURS and I can’t do it.
I’ve managed to edit some existing models, but I cant add my own.

HELP

I can use the 3d model making software easy, It’s just getting them to work on the client.

E.g

Say I wanted to add this…

if(i == 6611) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; class8.anIntArray156 = new int[2]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int[2]; class8.anIntArray156[0] = 933; class8.anIntArray160[0] = 6073; class8.anIntArray156[1] = 935; class8.anIntArray160[1] = 5959; class8.anInt174 = 6033; class8.anInt181 = 980; class8.anInt190 = 350; class8.anInt198 = 1020; class8.anInt204 = 324; class8.anInt169 = -2; class8.anInt194 = 0; class8.anInt165 = 13456; class8.anInt200 = 13456; class8.anInt175 = -1; class8.anInt197 = -1; class8.aString170 = "Ice Blade"; class8.aByteArray178 = "".getBytes(); }

I know that

class8.anInt165 = 13456; class8.anInt200 = 13456;

Are the ones for male and female wearing.
And that…

      class8.anInt174 = 6033;

Is the one for Inventory/Drop models.

But no matter what I do, when I go to equip my model, it turns into a null, or crashes my client.

Also, the client I am using comes with a built in model adder.
But it can never add the new models I am adding, ( And yes I have Put the .dat file into The models folder, and I have Gzip copies in there )

Is there a specific format the files need to be?

Can anyone help???

Read full topic
